com.googlecode.aluminumproject.context.g11n

Class GlobalisationContextProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.context.g11n.GlobalisationContextProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationElement, ContextEnricher

    public class GlobalisationContextProvider
extends Object
implements ContextEnricher
    Enriches the context with a globalisation context. Before each template, a globalisation context is made available as an implicit object. It can be obtained by using a utility method. After the template has been processed, the implicit object is removed again.

    When a context has a parent context that contains a globalisation context, it is inherited by the subcontext. In any other case, a new globalisation context is created. The following paragraphs describe the elements of a new globalisation context.

    The type of the locale provider that the globalisation context is created with can be configured with the "library.g11n.locale_provider.class" parameter. By default, a constant locale provider will be used with either the value of the configuration parameter "library.g11n.locale" or the default locale.

    The time zone provider contained by the globalisation context defaults to a constant one that uses the default time zone. Both the constant time zone and the time zone provider can be configured (using the "library.g11n.time_zone" and "library.g11n.time_zone_provider.class" parameters, respectively).

    The globalisation context's resource bundle provider will be name-based, unless a different one is configured via a configuration parameter named "library.g11n.resource_bundle_provider.class". The base name of the default resource bundle provider can be configured by using the "library.g11n.resource_bundle_provider.name_based.base_name" parameter; by default, "resources/aluminum" will be used.

    The date format provider that will be used for the globalisation context can be configured by providing a parameter named "library.g11n.date_format_provider.class". If none is configured, the date format provider will be based on the current locale and time zone. Its custom pattern will be "yyyy-MM-dd, HH:mm", unless the configuration contains a "library.g11n.date_format_provider.locale_based.custom_pattern" parameter.

    The default number format provider for the globalisation context is locale-based; a custom one can be configured through the "library.g11n.number_format_provider.class" parameter. The "library.g11n.date_format_provider.locale_based.custom_pattern" parameter controls custom pattern of the locale-based number format provider; without any configuration, "#,##0.##" will be used.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DATE_FORMAT_CUSTOM_PATTERN
      The name of the configuration parameter that contains the custom pattern that, when no date format provider is configured, the locale-based date format provider will be created with.
      static String DATE_FORMAT_PROVIDER_CLASS
      The name of the configuration parameter that holds the class name of the date format provider that should be used.
      static String DEFAULT_DATE_FORMAT_CUSTOM_PATTERN
      The custom pattern that will be supplied to the locale-based date format provider when neither a date provider nor a custom pattern is configured: "yyyy-MM-dd, HH:mm".
      static String DEFAULT_NUMBER_FORMAT_CUSTOM_PATTERN
      The custom pattern that will be used for the locale-based number format provider when none is configured: "#,##0.##".
      static String DEFAULT_RESOURCE_BUNDLE_BASE_NAME
      The base name that will be supplied to the name-based resource bundle provider if none is configured: "resources/aluminum".
      static String LOCALE
      The name of the configuration parameter that holds the locale that will be given to the constant locale provider when no locale provider is configured.
      static String LOCALE_PROVIDER_CLASS
      The name of the configuration parameter that contains the class name of the locale provider that should be used.
      static String NUMBER_FORMAT_CUSTOM_PATTERN
      The name of the configuration prarameter that holds the custom pattern to create the default number format provider with.
      static String NUMBER_FORMAT_PROVIDER_CLASS
      The name of the configuration parameter that contains the class name of the number format provider to use.
      static String RESOURCE_BUNDLE_BASE_NAME
      The name of the configuration parameter that contains the base name that will be passed to the name-based resource bundle provider when no resource bundle provider is configured.
      static String RESOURCE_BUNDLE_PROVIDER_CLASS
      The name of the configuration parameter with the class name of the resource bundle provider that should be used.
      static String TIME_ZONE
      The name of the configuration parameter that contains the time zone that should be provided when no time zone provider is configured.
      static String TIME_ZONE_PROVIDER_CLASS
      The name of the configuration parameter that controls which time zone provider will be used.
